intro: Schizobasis flagelliformis, commonly known as the flagellate sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in moist, wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense colonies. Schizobasis flagelliformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
